trustfund: TF023681-GEF2 - COSTA RICA : ECOMARKETS PROJECT,TF022382-GEF2: COSTA RICA ECOMARKETS PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Eco-Markets Project in Costa Rica,
            aims at promoting the development of markets for
            environmental services, from privately-owned forests. These
            services cover carbon sequestration, water resources, and
            bio-diversity protection. The environmental analysis summary
            outlines the eligibility criteria for beneficiaries, and
            describes the environmental service contracts (ESPs),
            establishing the applicable procedures regarding forest, and
            forestry plantations in the country, and promote
            re-forestation, and forest management protection. The
            environmental management plan addresses: 1) forest fire
            prevention, requiring the establishment of fire breaking
            clearances; 2) monitoring activity, to be accomplished by
            forestry inspectors, who should report annually, and
            recommend best practices; 3) reforestation, to be subjected
            to physical, and ecological conditions, i.e., types of soil,
            weather conditions, and, natural drainage. Participants who
            access ESPs, will subject the area under compensation to
            prevention, and control of forest fires, illegal hunting,
            and, extraction of forestry products; will assist the
            State's Forestry Management (SFM) in research, and
            education activities, and, fulfill the commitments
            established in the Forestry Law; will abide by the technical
            recommendations issued by the SFM, and cede - as needed -
            the rights derived from the ESPs to the National Forestry
            Financing Fund.
